title: Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy sold stocks two days before Trump announced a plan for reciprocal tariffs
summary: Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy sold stocks worth between $75,000 and $600,000 two days before Trump’s February 13 reciprocal tariff announcement, making him the second Trump cabinet official caught profiting off the White House’s turbulent global trade policies
